tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE energy_meter_data (
    meter_id INT NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    power_consumption DECIMAL,
    voltage DECIMAL,
    current DECIMAL,
    PRIMARY KEY (meter_id, timestamp)
);

CREATE TABLE meter_location (
    meter_id INT NOT NULL,
    location_name VARCHAR(255),
    street_address VARCHAR(255),
    city VARCHAR(100),
    state VARCHAR(50),
    country VARCHAR(50),
    PRIMARY KEY (meter_id)
);

CREATE TABLE energy_meters (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    energy_consumed DECIMAL,
    voltage DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE meter_readings (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT NOT NULL,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    reading DECIMAL,
    status VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE energy_meters (
  meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  install_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
  data_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  meter_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  value FLOAT,
  FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES energy_meters(meter_id)
)

CREATE TABLE anomalies (
  anomaly_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  data_id INT,
  issue VARCHAR(255),
  severity INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (data_id) REFERENCES sensor_data(data_id)
)

CREATE TABLE reports (
  report_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  report_date DATE,
  generated_by VARCHAR(255),
  data_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (data_id) REFERENCES sensor_data(data_id)
)

CREATE TABLE energy_meters (
    meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    install_date DATE,
    manufacturer VARCHAR(100),
    capacity INT
)

CREATE TABLE energy_readings (
    reading_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT REFERENCES energy_meters(meter_id),
    reading_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    consumption DECIMAL,
    voltage DECIMAL,
    current DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE meter_errors (
    error_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT REFERENCES energy_meters(meter_id),
    error_code VARCHAR(50),
    error_message TEXT,
    error_timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE meter_calibrations (
    calibration_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT REFERENCES energy_meters(meter_id),
    calibration_date DATE,
    calibration_factor DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE meter_statistics (
    stat_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT REFERENCES energy_meters(meter_id),
    total_readings INT,
    max_consumption DECIMAL,
    min_consumption DECIMAL,
    avg_consumption DECIMAL
)
